ratings.comment:
Really versed in the subject matter and expects you to take class seriously. Goes out of her way to help you be successful in the project while teaching you history and respect for the craft.
Don't take this class if you expect  a lightweight do what ever you like class for a grade.

The best class I have ever taken but also the hardest. Professor is absolutely amazing and very knowledgable. She is also kind and fair. You will work your tail off and learn so much. Definately not a class for slackers .

Lisa is incredible! Her passion for the craft comes through in every demo. Metalwork is extremely hard and time consuming, but the end result is always worth it. She can be tough, but only because she wants you to succeed and gain as much knowledge/skill as possible in a short period of time. If you get a chance to be in her class, take it!!

You will learn a lot in Lisa's class! She really cares about you succeeding in metals. The projects are challenging, but you'll be really excited about what you've made in the end. She can be harsh at times, but it's from a place of her wanting you to really do the best you can do. Stick with it and you will see the rewards of your work!
Tough teacher, and youll have to work a lot! But itll be worth it!!

Lisa is one of the coolest, most inspiring professors I have ever had. I feel honored to have learned from her, she is truly one of the best in her field. She is tough, but she provides her students with the skills and resources they need. Be prepared to work hard & dont get offended by her blunt personality. One of my favorite classes ever.

She's not understanding. This class is VERY demanding. If you have a job outside of class- better quit if you want to spend enough time to complete her projects and to her expectations. She does have A LOT of knowledge, but she isn't around much for actual help. Expect the studio to be closed 50% of the times you go in to work. Not a good teacher.
amazing professor with so much knowledge. Really cares about student success.

Lisa expects a fair amount of time & effort in and out of class; you should be prepared, willing, & excited for that fact. If you think metalwork is awesome & want to learn, do it! Taking this class with Lisa (amazing person and artist) had me (not an artist) falling in love with metalwork. Occasionally intimidating but not unfair. Heart of gold :)
best professor you will ever have. knows her stuff and really cares about teaching. Also a great artist and person.

Lisa is a fantastic teacher. She can be pretty tough, and yes a couple people cried, but if you pay attention to what she's saying and make an effort she has a TON of stuff to teach. Basically, she cares as much as you care. And she doesn't grade harshly as long as you turn in your projects on time.
Love, Love, Love this teacher!
She is demanding, intense, and extremely thorough. You will leave feeling like you have really learned something.

Honstestly one of the best professors I've ever had at any level of education.  Not for everyone may I add...her ideas and teaching style some may find radical but for the right person her teaching is as astounding as her artwork.  Her artwork is world class.
Not a good teacher!!!
Excellent!

I have seen her yell at students, and have heard stories from friends about her making them cry.  from what i perceive she either likes you or hates you.  i think she cares more about herself than her students
good luck getting on her good side

I felt she was not very helpful. Not a real concern for teaching as a craft. This department offers one of the few opportunities for students to have close personal contact with professors. I would like tosee her embrace the opportunity to truly inspire the students. She falls far short of this.
she is not very understanding. kind of pretentious becuase she taught in new york. overall, does not care too much for the individual student but is very interested in tenure.
Lisa was very thourough, lots of instruction, and easy to learn from.  A tough grader, some of the slcakers didn't like her, but if you did your time and made good work, she was great.
